alert.note: Alert for Henry; Patrick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 7:34AM EDT until May 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties, in north central North Carolina, Stokes and Surry. In Virginia, Henry and Patrick. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 732 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rains exiting. However, spotters reported minor stream flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since 3am, with over 3 inches since Thursday evening. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Ararat River, Buffalo Creek, Blackberry Creek, Big Creek, Baker Branch, Brushy Fork Creek, Archies Creek, Big Beaver Island Creek and Anglin Branch. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pilot Mountain... Stuart... Danbury... Francisco... Sandy Ridge... Woolwine... Bassett... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
